DataElement.preferredDefinition: Code to represent the classification of the severity or extent of disease (Wilms Tumor) following established criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being._An embryonal neoplasm characterized by the presence of epithelial, mesenchymal, and blastema components. The vast majority of cases arise from the kidney. A small number of cases with morphologic features resembling Wilms tumor of the kidney have been reported arising from the ovary and the cervix._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being.:An embryonal neoplasm characterized by the presence of epithelial, mesenchymal, and blastema components. The vast majority of cases arise from the kidney. A small number of cases with morphologic features resembling Wilms tumor of the kidney have been reported arising from the ovary and the cervix.

Concepts.definition: An embryonal neoplasm characterized by the presence of epithelial, mesenchymal, and blastema components. The vast majority of cases arise from the kidney. A small number of cases with morphologic features resembling Wilms tumor of the kidney have been reported arising from the ovary and the cervix.

Property.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Nephrectomy specimen with tumor that is present at the surgical margin of resection or within regional lymph nodes; distant metastasis identified at diagnosis
